properties.description:
Christ Church, Gypsy Hill is open  as a warm space, with activities, food, company & conversation.


When: Tuesday from  11:00 am - 12:00 pm

Activity: Moving into Wellbeing

If you would like to get moving again; if you are a little creaky around the joints or hoping to find muscles you never knew you had, come and join our 'Moving into Wellbeing' group. You will get a very warm welcome, and a gentle chair-based introduction into movement exercises at a pace you can cope with.

Come and give us a try - it's free, friendly, and fine just to turn up!


When: Tuesday  from 12:00 pm - 2:30 pm

Activity: Open Door - Community Drop In

All are welcome to join us around the lunch table - with an opportunity to chat and join in the range of activities that are offered from time to time.


Activity: Open Door Community Choir - open to all!

When: Tuesday from 1:45 pm 

Come and join in with our new community choir - whether you are a long-time singer or have never tried to sing a note before, we aim to have lots of fun making music together.


Where: Christ Church, Gipsy Hill 1, Highland Road SE19 1DP

Visit our website for details of other weekly events that require registration.

https://www.gipsyhill.org.uk/


Parking, WiFi, Accessible Toilets, Hot Drinks, Charging Facilities, Child Friendly

hours._text:
Open every Friday 1pm to 3pm.
Link Age Southwark, in partnership with the United Reformed Church (URC), will be offering a free hot lunch and afternoon social session. Lunch will be provided by the URC and will consist of home-made soup and a bread roll. There will also be board games and activities available for local residents aged over 60 and those with a diagnosis of dementia. Family members and carers are also welcome to attend with the person they support.

Opening times

  • 21 November 2022 (12 noon onwards)
  • 12 December 2022 (12 noon onwards)
  • 19 December 2022 (12 noon onwards)

The Dragon Café brings people together to join in creative activities such as creative writing sessions, a singing group, poetry, drawing, mindful meditation, and a dance group. The emphasis of these activities is always to have fun and to feel connected to other members of the community. These events also provide much needed connection with peers and an opportunity to socialise and will provide free food for those who attend.
